paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted BRCA2 variant information and penetrance data from a study on breast cancer.

patients.phenotype: bilateral breast ductal carcinoma diagnosed at age 44

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The BRCA2 variant NM_000059.4:c.2471T>G was identified in a 61 year-old patient that was diagnosed with bilateral breast ductal carcinoma at the age of 44.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with breast cancer.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation
variants.additional_notes: No additional functional assays or population frequency data provided.
key_quotes: The BRCA2 variant NM_000059.4:c.2471T>G was identified in a 61 year-old patient that was diagnosed with bilateral breast ductal carcinoma at the age of 44.

patients.phenotype: no history of breast or ovarian neoplasia

individual_records.phenotype_details: no history of breast or ovarian neoplasia
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The BRCA2 variant NM_000059.4:c.5576_5579delTTAA has been cited in breast and ovarian cancer cases.

functional_data.summary: The deletion of four nucleotides leads to a frameshift that likely causes a truncated protein or a complete absence of the transcript.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on variant characteristics
variants.additional_notes: No additional functional assays or population frequency data provided.
key_quotes: The BRCA2 variant NM_000059.4:c.5576_5579delTTAA has been cited in breast and ovarian cancer cases.

individual_records.phenotype_details: bilateral BC with lobular carcinoma in the right breast and ductal carcinoma in the left breast
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The BRCA2 variant NM_000059.3:c.8331+1G>A was identified in a 52-year-old patient that was diagnosed with bilateral BC at the ages of 39, with lobular carcinoma in the right breast, and 47, with ductal carcinoma in the left breast.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with breast cancer.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation
variants.additional_notes: No additional functional assays or population frequency data provided.
key_quotes: The BRCA2 variant NM_000059.3:c.8331+1G>A was identified in a 52-year-old patient that was diagnosed with bilateral BC at the ages of 39, with lobular carcinoma in the right breast, and 47, with ductal carcinoma in the left breast.

tables_processed.table_caption: Clinical pathological findings of the patients

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant BRCA2 variants and penetrance data were successfully extracted.
